intro: Ouratea pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite and usually ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
